div.p: This implementation guide conforms with the following key reporting requirements as identified by the Univeristy of Zambia (University of Zambia, Medical Library, 2017).

HIV CBS is routinely generated individual-level information tha must be captured using a single case report containing information pertaining only to that person which forms a longitudinal record of treatment and care outcomes. DISI's reference platform architecture provides a centralised data repository that will enable implementers to monitor and measure the full spectrum of the disease from diagnosis to death.
Laboratory data elements must be reported in one or more of the following ways.

ol.li: Lab data can be submitted directly to an EMR electronically provided the communication stream adheres to country laws in regards to privacy & confidentiality. Lab results must be shared with the requesting organisation/provider or individual as applicable.
Lab data can be submitted directly to a centralised data repository, stripped of all personally identifiable information (PII) and later be routed to an analytics platform for reporting.

Lab data can be submitted to an EMR via a health information exchange (HIE). It will be the responsibility of the interoperability layer to facilitate the mediation of the message to the correct destination system.

div.p: The following list of data elements should be provided for the purpose of HIV case reporting.

ul.li: The data elements in scope for this implementation guide are defined by the HIV CBS Minimum Dataset.
Test requested (must use the LOINC code system for harmonization)
Test result - measured as copies per millilitre of blood (copies/mL)
This is calculated using the patient's date of birth.
Lab order requesting provider zip code
Lab examination performing provider zip code
Specimen type (must use appropriate codes issued by LOINC or SNOMED)
Patient name (Last name, First name, Middle Initial)
Patient contact details with area code
Lab order requesting provider contact details
Patient's date of enrolment in HIV care
Patient's ARV regimen (including any regimen switches)

li.strong: Currently, only lost to follow-up (LTFU) is supported.

div.p: The use case diagram for this implementation guide identifies the key functions on offer in order to assist with the various CBS sentinel events associated with HIV.
